verses.verse: These also are proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon<WH8010>, which the men<WH582> of Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> copied out<WH6275>.
It is the glory<WH3519> of God<WH430> to conceal<WH5641> a thing<WH1697>; But the glory<WH3519> of kings<WH4428> is to search out<WH2713> a matter<WH1697>.
As the heavens<WH8064> for height<WH7312>, and the earth<WH776> for depth<WH6011>, So the heart<WH3820> of kings<WH4428> is unsearchable<WH2714>.
Take away<WH1898> the dross<WH5509> from the silver<WH3701>, And there cometh forth<WH3318> a vessel<WH3627> for the refiner<WH6884>:
Take away<WH1898> the wicked<WH7563> from before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, And his throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> in righteousness<WH6664>.
Put not thyself forward<WH1921> in the presence<WH6440> of the king<WH4428>, And stand<WH5975> not in the place<WH4725> of great men<WH1419>:

For better<WH2896> is it that it be said<WH559> unto thee<WH5927>, Come up hither<WH8213>, Than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence<WH6440> of the prince<WH5081>, Whom thine eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200>.
Go not forth<WH3318> hastily<WH4118> to strive<WH7378>, Lest thou know not what to do<WH6213> in the end<WH319> thereof<WH7453>, When thy neighbor hath put thee to shame<WH3637>.
Debate <WH7378> thy cause<WH7379> with thy neighbor<WH7453> himself<WH1540>, And disclose not the secret<WH5475> of another<WH312>;
Lest he that heareth<WH8085> it revile<WH2616> thee<WH1681>, And thine infamy turn not away<WH7725>.
A word<WH1697> fitly<WH212> spoken<WH1696> Is like apples<WH8598> of gold<WH2091> in network<WH4906> of silver<WH3701>.
As an ear-ring<WH5141> of gold<WH2091>, and an ornament<WH2481> of fine gold<WH3800>, So is a wise<WH2450> reprover<WH3198> upon an obedient<WH8085> ear<WH241>.

As the cold<WH6793> of snow<WH7950> in the time<WH3117> of harvest<WH7105>, So is a faithful<WH539> messenger<WH6735> to them that send<WH7971> him<WH7725>; For he refresheth the soul<WH5315> of his masters<WH113>.
As clouds<WH5387> and wind<WH7307> without rain<WH1653>, So is he<WH376> that boasteth<WH1984> himself of his gifts<WH4991> falsely<WH8267>.
By long<WH753> forbearing<WH639> is a ruler<WH7101> persuaded<WH6601>, And a soft<WH7390> tongue<WH3956> breaketh<WH7665> the bone<WH1634>.
Hast thou found<WH4672> honey<WH1706>? eat<WH398> so much as is sufficient<WH1767> for thee<WH7646>, Lest thou be filled therewith<WH6958>, and vomit it.
Let thy foot<WH7272> be seldom<WH3365> in thy neighbor<WH7453>'s house<WH1004>, Lest he be weary<WH7646> of thee<WH8130>, and hate thee.
A man<WH376> that beareth<WH6030> false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> against his neighbor<WH7453> Is a maul<WH4650>, and a sword<WH2719>, and a sharp<WH8150> arrow<WH2671>.
Confidence <WH4009> in an unfaithful man<WH898> in time<WH3117> of trouble<WH6869> Is like a broken<WH7465> tooth<WH8127>, and a foot<WH7272> out of joint<WH4154>.

As one that taketh off<WH5710> a garment<WH899> in cold<WH7135> weather<WH3117>, and as vinegar<WH2558> upon soda<WH5427>, So is he that singeth<WH7891> songs<WH7892> to a heavy<WH7451> heart<WH3820>.
If thine enemy<WH8130> be hungry<WH7457>, give him bread<WH3899> to eat<WH398>; And if he be thirsty<WH6771>, give him water<WH4325> to drink<WH8248>:
For thou wilt heap<WH2846> coals of fire<WH1513> upon his head<WH7218>, And Jehovah<WH3068> will reward thee<WH7999>.
The north<WH6828> wind<WH7307> bringeth forth<WH2342> rain<WH1653>: So doth a backbiting<WH5643> tongue<WH3956> an angry<WH2194> countenance<WH6440>.
It is better<WH2896> to dwell<WH3427> in the corner<WH6438> of the housetop<WH1406>, Than with a contentious<WH4079> woman<WH802> in a wide<WH2267> house<WH1004>.
As cold<WH7119> waters<WH4325> to a thirsty<WH5889> soul<WH5315>, So is good<WH2896> news<WH8052> from a far<WH4801> country<WH776>.
As a troubled<WH7515> fountain<WH4599>, and a corrupted<WH7843> spring<WH4599>, So is a righteous<WH6662> man that giveth<WH4131> way before<WH6440> the wicked<WH7563>.
It is not good<WH2896> to eat<WH398> much<WH7235> honey<WH1706>: So for men to search<WH2714> out their own glory<WH3519> is grievous<WH3519>.
He <WH376> whose spirit<WH7307> is without restraint<WH4623> Is like a city<WH5892> that is broken down<WH6555> and without walls<WH2346>.
